page.title: 01OUR AREA
page.content: Our area is situated 3km.north of Bolton town centre.The north of our area is high moorland only suitable for sheep grazing.On lower land there is a small amount of dairy farming. Further south the area becomes residential and some industry takes place.The houses vary from old terraced to semi-detached and detached. There are three major roads.These are Blackburn Road which divides to form Belmont Road,Halliwell Road which becomes Smithills Dean Road and Moss Bank Way which is a ring road round Bolton. In our area there are three streams, Astley Brook joins Raveden Brook and later on at Astley Bridge these are joined by Eagley Brook to form the River Tonge.
